s.description: The smallest border size. Used for gridlines.

m.description: The default border size. Used for axes borders, default data lines.

l.description: A larger border size. Used for borders between filled elements.

xl.description: A larger border size. Used for lines in focus, and the bottom chart container line.

xxl.description: The largest border size. Used for the top chart container line.

authors.value: Moritz Stefaner / Truth & Beauty with Christian Laesser, Alice Thudt, Flavio Gortana

huge.description: Used for summary statistics, large numbers, etc.

title.description: Used for the title of a chart.

majorPrimary.description: Used for legend main labels, as well as individual value annotations.

majorSecondary.description: Used for secondary legend labels, description, and the chart subtitle.

minorPrimary.description: Used for smaller annotations in charts.

minorSecondary.description: Used for tick labels, secondary annotations, footer text.

base.description: The default light background color, used e.g. as a backdrop for charts or cards.

weaker.description: A slightly shaded background color, used e.g. as a backdrop behind card elements.

weakest.description: A shaded background color, used e.g. as a backdrop in containers.

base.description: Used for elements in the foreground that have a strong contrast to the background.

weaker.description: Used for elements in the foreground that have a weaker contrast to the background (e.g. axes).

weakest.description: Used for elements in the foreground that have the weakest contrast to the background (e.g. ticks, help-lines)

base.description: Default text color for strong background contrast.

weaker.description: Text color with weaker background contrast.

base.description: Main theme color, usually the brand color.

accent.description: Used for author-driven accents of parts of charts, texts and other elements.

filteredOut.description: Used for visual marks in charts that have been filtered out.

focus.description: Used for author-driven accents of parts of charts, texts and other elements.

notAvailable.description: Used for visual marks (e.g. countries in maps) where data is missing from the dataset.

1.description: Second step in the base diverging color scale, used for values lower than zero (or data median).

2.description: First step in the based diverging color scale, used for the lowest (most negative) value.

neutral.description: Third step in the base diverging color scale, used for zero or data median.

1.description: Fifth step in the base diverging color scale, used for the highest (most positive) value.

2.description: Fourth step in the base diverging color scale, used for values higher than zero (or data median).

0.description: First step in the base (theme) sequential color scale, used for the lowest value.

1.description: Second step in the base (theme) sequential color scale.

2.description: Thirs step in the base (theme) sequential color scale.

3.description: Third and final step in the base (theme) sequential color scale.

stronger.description: Stronger text color for maximum background contrast.

base.description: Second step in the base diverging color scale, used for values lower than zero (or data median).

weaker.description: Second step in the base diverging color scale, used for values lower than zero (or data median).

stronger.description: First step in the based diverging color scale, used for the lowest (most negative) value.
